function.summary: Sets are formed from the nodes in each sequence, removing duplicates in the process of forming sets. Returns true if for every node in the left sequence's set there is an s-equal node in the right sequence's set, and the sets have the same count of members.

input.name: left
input.xhtml:p: The first node or sequence of nodes.

input.name: right
input.xhtml:p: The second node or sequence of nodes.

output.xhtml:p: Sets are formed from the nodes in each sequence, removing duplicates in the process of forming sets. Returns true if for every node in the left sequence's set there is an s-equal node in the right sequence's set, and the sets have the same count of members.

reg:revision.xhtml:p: Clarified that sets are formed from the sequences, removing duplicates in the process of forming sets, and that operation is on the members of the (deduplicated) sets.
